1.text: My son, keep my words, and lay up my precepts with thee. Son,

2.text: Keep my commandments, and thou shalt live: and my law as the apple of thy eye:

3.text: Bind it upon thy fingers, write it upon the tables of thy heart.

4.text: Say to wisdom: Thou art my sister: and call prudence thy friend,

5.text: That she may keep thee from the woman that is not thine, and from the stranger who sweeteneth her words.

6.text: For I look out of the window of my house through the lattice,

7.text: And I see little ones, I behold a foolish young man,

8.text: Who passeth through the street by the corner, and goeth nigh the way of her house.

9.text: In the dark, when it grows late, in the darkness and obscurity of the night,

10.text: And behold a woman meeteth him in harlotâ€™s attire prepared to deceive souls; talkative and wandering,

11.text: Not bearing to be quiet, not able to abide still at home,

12.text: Now abroad, now in the streets, now lying in wait near the corners.

13.text: And catching the young man, she kisseth him, and with an impudent face, flattereth, saying:

14.text: I vowed victims for prosperity, this day I have paid my vows.

15.text: Therefore I am come out to meet thee, desirous to see thee, and I have found thee.

16.text: I have woven my bed with cords, I have covered it with painted tapestry, brought from Egypt.

17.text: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

18.text: Come, let us be inebriated with the breasts, and let us enjoy the desired embraces, till the day appear.

19.text: For my husband is not at home, he is gone a very long journey.

20.text: He took with him a bag of money: he mill return home the day of the full moon.

21.text: She entangled him with many words, and drew him away with the flattery of her lips.

22.text: Immediately he followeth her as an ox led to be a victim, and as a lamb playing the wanton, and not knowing that he is drawn like a fool to bonds,

23.text: Till the arrow pierce his liver: as if a bird should make haste to the snare, and knoweth not that his life is in danger.

24.text: Now therefore, my son, hear me, and attend to the words of my mouth.

25.text: Let not thy mind be drawn away in her ways: neither be thou deceived with her paths.

26.text: For she hath cast down many wounded, and the strongest have been slain by her.

27.text: Her house is the way to hell, reaching even to the inner chambers of death.
